conclusion: Need to analyze the graph of the reciprocal of the velocity versus displacement to determine acceleration or deceleration.
The graph shows 1/v on the y-axis and x on the x-axis.
The slope of the graph represents the rate of change of 1/v with respect to x.
A positive slope indicates 1/v increases with x, meaning v decreases with x.
A negative slope would indicate 1/v decreases with x, meaning v increases with x.
Relate 1/v versus x to acceleration using a = dv/dt = v * dv/dx.
The graph shows a straight line with a positive slope.
A positive slope implies d/dx(1/v) > 0, thus 1/v increases with x.
If v decreases with x, the particle is slowing down, indicating deceleration.
